title: [BUG] unspecified bug with `KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier` in 0.8.0
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
dtw_distance in sktime.distances.elastic_cython leads to very bad classification result on ArrowHead Dataset in Version 0.8
-->

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Train OneNN on ArrowHead Dataset with different versions of dtw distance and compare the results
-->

```python

# Version that works fine (V1)
from sktime.distances.elastic import dtw_distance
oneNNDTW = KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier(distance=dtw_distance)

# Version that works not as expected (V2)
from sktime.distances.elastic_cython import dtw_distance
oneNNDTW = KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier(distance=dtw_distance)
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
Both versions should lead to similar accuracy in classification result. But: V2 leads to classification result of 0.4857, while V1 leads to 0.7657.
-->

**Additional context**
<!--

-->

**Versions**
0.8.0

<!--
Please run the following code snippet and paste the output here:
 
python: 3.9.7 (default, Sep 16 2021, 08:50:36)  [Clang 10.0.0 ]
executable:{ .....}bin/python
   machine: macOS-10.15.7-x86_64-i386-64bit

Python dependencies:
          pip: 21.2.4
   setuptools: 58.0.4
      sklearn: 1.0
       sktime: 0.8.0
  statsmodels: 0.13.0
        numpy: 1.20.3
        scipy: 1.7.1
       Cython: None
       pandas: 1.3.4
   matplotlib: 3.4.3
       joblib: 1.1.0
        numba: 0.54.1
     pmdarima: None
      tsfresh: None
-->


</details>
